previous_positions: Head of Enterprise Partnerships – Shopify Plus (earlier role at Shopify)
Program Leader – Communitech (early career, startup services programs)
achievements: Attracted **Shopify** to Waterloo Region, later joining as **Head of Enterprise Partnerships** and scaling Shopify Plus operations, contributing to 1,000+ local jobs.
As **Country Lead at Atomic**, spearheaded Canadian expansion of San Francisco startups through Terminal, creating **500+ engineering jobs** across Waterloo, Vancouver, Toronto, and Montreal.

Advisor to **Open Quantum Design**, building the world’s first open-source full-stack quantum computer in collaboration with leading scientists and institutions (e.g., University of Waterloo, Xanadu).
Served as EVP at **StartupSoft**, connecting Canadian engineers with startups and Fortune 10 companies.
Co-founded **ETHWaterloo**, the world’s largest Ethereum hackathon and the first ETHGlobal event.
Longtime mentor and volunteer with **Hack the North**, **Techstars NYC**, and the **Founder Institute**.

degree: Business Advisory Board role (University of Waterloo)
activities: Business Advisory Board, Waterloo Region community leadership

recent_achievements: Joined **Open Quantum Design** as Advisor to help shape the world’s first open-source quantum computer.
Scaled Shopify Plus’ presence in Waterloo, contributing to Shopify’s hypergrowth era.
Expanded San Francisco startups into Canada, bridging ecosystems and creating hundreds of jobs.
conversation_starters: Ask about Open Quantum Design’s mission and what it means to build the world’s first open-source full-stack quantum computer.
Discuss his role in bringing Shopify to Waterloo and lessons from scaling Shopify Plus.
Explore how he bridged Silicon Valley startups into Canada through Atomic and Terminal.
Mention ETHWaterloo and the global Ethereum ecosystem he helped foster.
notable_projects: Open Quantum Design – first open-source full-stack quantum computer
Shopify Plus – enterprise scaling in Waterloo
Atomic/Terminal – Canadian expansion for SF startups
StartupSoft – connecting engineers with Fortune 10 companies

credibility_indicators: Recognized leader in Waterloo tech ecosystem
Founder of ETHWaterloo and advisor to multiple global organizations
Track record of creating jobs and scaling ecosystems
potential_red_flags: Frequent transitions across organizations (reflective of ecosystem-building focus rather than long-term operator roles).
Heavily ecosystem/community-oriented, may not fit all purely corporate-focused contexts.
person_analysis.overview: Nabil G. Fahel is a Waterloo-based founder, investor, and ecosystem builder with two decades of experience scaling startups, attracting global companies to Canada, and founding impactful initiatives. He played a pivotal role in Shopify’s hypergrowth by establishing Shopify Plus in Waterloo, co-founded ETHWaterloo (the world’s largest Ethereum hackathon), and led Atomic/Terminal’s Canadian expansion efforts, creating over 500 engineering jobs. Today, he advises Open Quantum Design, building the world’s first open-source full-stack quantum computer, while continuing to mentor founders through Hack the North, Techstars, and other programs. His career reflects a unique blend of business expansion, ecosystem building, and frontier tech innovation.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Nabil G. Fahel is a founder, investor, and strategic ecosystem leader with deep roots in Waterloo’s tech community. He has scaled organizations like Shopify, Atomic, and Terminal while founding ETHWaterloo and advising next-generation ventures such as Open Quantum Design. With expertise in partnerships, entrepreneurship, and global expansion, he has facilitated the creation of thousands of jobs in Canada’s tech ecosystem. Nabil combines a global network with local community commitment, making him a key figure in bridging startups, investors, and emerging technologies.
key_insights: Advisor at **Open Quantum Design**, helping build the first open-source full-stack quantum computer.
Founder of **ETHWaterloo**, which seeded ETHGlobal and became a global Ethereum landmark.
Scaled Shopify Plus operations in Waterloo, creating over 1,000 jobs.
Expanded Canadian engineering ecosystems for San Francisco startups through Atomic/Terminal.
Deeply community-driven with strong volunteer presence at Hack the North and Techstars.
